test_functions module¶

test_functions.mean_val(a, b)[source]¶

This function returns the mean of arguments a and b: 0.5(a + b)

Parameters:
  • a (float) – The first value.
  • b (float) – The second value.
Returns:

The mean value.
Return type:

float
Example:
>>> mean_val(2, 5)
3.5
test_functions.square_root(val, tol=0.0001)[source]¶

This is a docstring. Here I would explain what the square_root() function does. (It calculates the square root. Duh.)

Parameters:
  • a (float) – The value whose square root you want to calculate.
  • tol (float) – The tolerance of the solver. Smaller tolerance leads to higher precision. Default: 1e-4.
Returns:

The square root of parameter val
Return type:

float
Example:
>>> value = square_root(4)
>>> print(value)
2.0
